abstract: Revelation that New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo's five-year capital plan for the Metropolitan Transportation Authority would ask New York City to contribute more than $3 billion comes as surprise to de Blasio administration; figure, substantially higher than city's previous obligation to the MTA's budget, rekindles debate over fiscal responsibility for New York's sprawling transit system.
lead_paragraph: The governor’s update on a five-year capital plan for the state-run transportation agency raised once again questions about the proper scope of New York City’s role in its own transit destiny.

headline.main: Cuomo’s Plan to Close M.T.A. Funding Gap Revives Familiar Debate
headline.print_headline: Cuomo’s Plan for M.T.A. Budget Gap Revives Issue of City’s Financial Role

snippet: The governor’s update on a five-year capital plan for the state-run transportation agency raised once again questions about the proper scope of New York City’s role in its own transit destiny.
